page.title: 07Modern housing Bridlington
page.content: Most of the new housing development is taking place along Marton Road towards Sewerby. Here are the Sandacre and Barleycroft estates. A variety of styles can be found here dating from the 1960's and 1970's including semi-detached houses and bungalows. There is a small "Sandacre Centre" providing a Post Office, hairdressers and "Spar" supermarket. A new "Barrett" and "Wimpey" housing development is near here and many young families have moved into these homes. There is also a "Barrett" housing estate situated off Bempton Lane. This estate consists of a mixture semis, two storey flats and bungalows dating from the late 1970's. The "Avenues" is an area of post-war development consisting of semis,detached and bungalows arranged in parallel, tree-lined avenues.
